reviewText: I have two of Neil Sedaka's concert DVDs, and this one is the best.  It includes those great singable lyrics of his 1960s hits.  The songs are not edited down, and Neil displays his usual enthusiasm in entertaining his audience.  I also have a DVD entitled Neil Sedaka--Live in Concert at the Jubilee Hall, but it is not as good as this one, The Show Goes On.  My after school music students in grades four through seven enjoyed seeing him perform the songs they were introduced to previously.  If you enjoy his music you can't go wrong in adding this concert to your collection.
summary: This Is The One To Buy
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you want to feel young agaig watch and listen to the songs you grew up with.  This long playing dvd covers Neil fifty four years of writting and singing songs and he even comes up with some secrets for us.  His interacting with the audiance makes him truely great performer.  You will definitely feel younger listening to memory lane of rock-n-roll songs as rock-n-roll has never died and the beat will have you going in some way.Jeff C.
summary: Neil Sedaka a life time of rock-n-roll

reviewText: A bit too rehearsed, but well photographed with good sound quality, and a great interview given as a bonus.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Neil Sedaka, in my mind, is an understated performer in that he is not overly showy or loud...he is an extremely talented songwriter and his music will live on and on.  This is a very enjoyable DVD and one that you will watch over and over.
summary: Neil just goes on and on

reviewText: I thought this dvd would be better.  There were too many songs I did not care for.  The older great songs he sand did not seem to be with the quality they had when they first hit the market.  Age has taken its toll.
